derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Italian ombrella, diminutive of ombra 'shade', from Latin umbra (see umbra)

encyclopedia.content: 生化危机中安布雷拉公司编年史： 1960年，声名显赫的亚西福特家族（ashford)第六代继承人爱德华·亚西福特（edward ashford)和年轻贵族奥斯威尔·e·斯宾塞(oswell spenser)在进行古生物研究时从女王蚁的基因中发现一种古代病毒，病毒的特征立刻引起他们的震惊，这是一种能使生物体基因变异，丧失思想意识的病毒，同时他们也发现，被感染者会拥有极强的抵抗力和生命力，两人马上意识到将这种病毒用于军事上的巨大用途，于是将这种

entry.def: An umbrella is an object which you use to protect yourself from the rain or hot sun. It consists of a long stick with a folding frame covered in cloth.

example.ex: Harry held an umbrella over Dawn.

entry.def: Umbrella is used to refer to a single group or description that includes a lot of different organizations or ideas.

example.ex: Does coincidence come under the umbrella of the paranormal?...
example.tran: 巧合属于超自然现象吗？

example.ex: Within the umbrella term 'dementia' there are many different kinds of disease.
example.tran: “痴呆”这一统称里包括多种不同的疾病。

entry.tran: 保护伞（指保护某个国家或群体的体制或协议）
entry.def: Umbrella is used to refer to a system or agreement which protects a country or group of people.

example.ex: The major powers have chosen to act under the moral umbrella of the United Nations...
example.tran: 世界主要大国都选择在联合国的道义框架下行事。

example.ex: Britain cannot avoid being under the US nuclear umbrella, whether it wants to or not.
example.tran: 不管愿不愿意，英国都免不了要处于美国的核保护伞之下。

means.word_mean: 2. a formation of military planes maintained over ground operations or targets;
3. having the function of uniting a group of similar things;

sentences.sentence: "the Democratic Party is an umbrella for many liberal groups"

means.word_mean: 1. covering or applying simultaneously to a number of similar items or elements or groups;
